page.title: 14EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Traditionally Sunderland was dominated by a small number of large employers in heavy industry:shipbuilding,coal mining and engineering.Their decline in recent years has led to high levels of unemployment.This year unemployment is running at 22% whilst the national average is 14%.In Sunderland 27% of males are unemployed and long term unemployment is a serious problem. (Young People-)Of those leaving school only 25% get permanent jobs.The remainder go on Y.T.S.Schemes.There are only 45 vacancies for 2042 leavers. (Youth Training Scheme-)Offers temporary work and training for upto a year.60% of 16 and 17 year olds are on such schemes. (Employment Trends-)Light industry like Nissan and nursery units.
